About Me

BIO

I'm Mohammad Hussain a passionate front-end developer with over 5 years of web development experience building responsive, accessible and cross browser compatible websites and applications. I specialise in HTML, CSS and JavaScript and have experience working with content management systems such as Wordpress and Episerver for some of the UK's largest clients: Bank of England, Metropolitan Police and the British Army. If you have a project in mind and would like to discuss further please contact me.

CDS

Front end developer

The Metropolitan Police were in need of a website which allowed users to report crimes and incidents with ease, we developed an efficient online form process for users to find their correct police department.

Episerver was chosen as the preferred CMS and a custom built front-end toolkit was created which comprised of generic tools and helpers to build the templates. The complexity required to build the forms engine and various other UI components needed careful consideration throughout the development process, we adopted a number of techniques with progressive enhancement to optimise the experience for devices of differing types and capabilities.

Hitachi Capital

Web Designer

During my time at Hitachi Capital I was involved in all aspects of the project life cycle from design to development and testing, working alongside a large back-end team helped me greatly in developing and integrating my skills within the company.

Hitachi Capital divisions:

  • Hitachi Capital Consumer Finance
  • Hitachi Capital Invoice Finance
  • Hitachi Capital Vehicle Solutions
  • Hitachi Capital Business Finance
  • Hitachi Personal Finance

Being part of a small front-end team I was involved in various projects for all Hitachi Capital divisions, my work ranged from wire-framing, designing, creating emails to developing small and large websites using custom frameworks. I was given the opportunity to develop the first responsive website for the company and was awarded with an “INSPIRE AWARD”.
